snippet: As the snow fell, the Republican and Democratic candidates carried on, with at least one front-runner wondering how the weather would affect turnout.
abstract: Presidential candidates make last-ditch effort to persuade undecided voters in New Hampshire ahead of nation's first primary election; New Hampshire has long history of defying polls, but some candidates also wonder how predicted snowstorm could affect turnout.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Michael Barbaro from Nashua, N.H.; Jess Bidgood from Plaistow, N.H.; John Corrales from Concord, N.H.; Steve Eder from Hampstead, N.H.; Thomas Kaplan from Salem, N.H.; Alex Thompson from Raymond, N.H.; and Jason Horowitz, Patrick Healy, Jonathan Martin and Ashley Parker from Manchester.

lead_paragraph: As the snow fell, the Republican and Democratic candidates carried on, with at least one front-runner wondering how the weather would affect turnout.

headline.main: New Hampshire Voters Hear Candidates’ Final Appeals Before Primary
headline.print_headline: Candidates Swap Spirited Blows Ahead of Voting
